new ImageCache(): ImageCache

summary.text: The image to be used to notify for a pending download request - e.g. loading indicator.

signatures.code: placeholder: ImageSource

summary.text: The image to be used to notify for a pending download request - e.g. loading indicator.
The maximum number of simultaneous download requests. Defaults to 5.

signatures.code: maxRequests: number

summary.text: The maximum number of simultaneous download requests. Defaults to 5.

signatures.code: enableDownload(): void

summary.text: Enables previously suspended download requests.

signatures.code: disableDownload(): void

summary.text: Temporary disables download requests.

signatures.code: push(request: DownloadRequest): any

summary.text: Adds a new download request at the top of the download queue. This will be the next immediate download to start.

signatures.code: enqueue(request: DownloadRequest): any

summary.text: Adds a new download request at the end of the download queue. This will be the last download to start.

signatures.code: get(key: string): any

summary.text: Gets the image for the specified key. May be undefined if the key is not present in the cache.

signatures.code: set(key: string, image: any): void

summary.text: Sets the image for the specified key.

signatures.code: remove(key: string): void

summary.text: Removes the cache for the specified key.

signatures.code: clear(): void

summary.text: Removes all the previously cached images.

signatures.code: on(eventNames: string, callback: (args: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: A basic method signature to hook an event listener (shortcut alias to the addEventListener method).
String corresponding to events (e.g. "propertyChange"). Optionally could be used more events separated by
(e.g. "propertyChange", "change").
Callback function which will be executed when event is raised.
An optional parameter which will be used as
`this`
context for callback execution.

signatures.code: on(event: "downloaded", callback: (args: DownloadedData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Raised when the image has been downloaded.

signatures.code: on(event: "downloadError", callback: (args: DownloadError) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Raised if the image download errors.

signatures.code: setProperty(name: string, value: any): void

summary.text: Updates the specified property with the provided value and raises a property change event and a specific change event based on the property name.

signatures.code: once(event: string, callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Adds one-time listener function for the event named
`event`
Name of the event to attach to.
A function to be called when the specified event is raised.
An optional parameter which when set will be used as "this" in callback method call.

signatures.code: off(eventNames: string, callback?: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Shortcut alias to the removeEventListener method.

signatures.code: addEventListener(eventNames: string, callback: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Adds a listener for the specified event name.
Comma delimited names of the events to attach the listener to.
A function to be called when some of the specified event(s) is raised.
An optional parameter which when set will be used as "this" in callback method call.

signatures.code: removeEventListener(eventNames: string, callback?: (data: EventData) => void, thisArg?: any): void

summary.text: Removes listener(s) for the specified event name.
Comma delimited names of the events the specified listener is associated with.
An optional parameter pointing to a specific listener. If not defined, all listeners for the event names will be removed.
An optional parameter which when set will be used to refine search of the correct callback which will be removed as event listener.

signatures.code: notify<T>(data: T): void

summary.text:
Notify this Observable instance with some data. This causes all event
handlers on the Observable instance to be called, as well as any 'global'
event handlers set on the instance's class.

an object that satisfies the EventData interface, though with
an optional 'object' property. If left undefined, the 'object' property
will implicitly be set as this Observable instance.

signatures.code: notifyPropertyChange(name: string, value: any, oldValue?: any): void

summary.text: Notifies all the registered listeners for the property change event.

signatures.code: hasListeners(eventName: string): boolean

summary.text: Checks whether a listener is registered for the specified event name.
The name of the event to check for.

signatures.code: _createPropertyChangeData(propertyName: string, value: any, oldValue?: any): PropertyChangeData

summary.text: This method is intended to be overriden by inheritors to provide additional implementation.

signatures.code: _emit(eventNames: string): void
